metadata.synopsis: Dialog after kill Dolor in Figaro's Cosmetic Shop. Valeria alive.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Speak with Valeria in Figaro's Cosmetic Shop after kill Dolor there.Coordinates: larian://bookmark?mod=GustavDev&level=BGO_Main_A&camPos=-1915.238892;41.772476;637.191650&camTarget=-1914.994141;41.278557;636.357300Relevant flags in this page: https://larianstudios.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GUS/pages/2624159852/Lower+City+Debug+Commands

3.speaker: Narrator
3.text: |RANDOM FLAMING FIST LEADING A NO-DEVELLA NO-VALERIA FLOW (SHORTER)|

5.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player takes a second to catch their breath. They've just defeated a serial killer they've been on the trail of for hours. They survey the scene, and then their attention is drawn off-stage.

50.speaker: Valeria
50.text: Move your tiny legs faster, Devella, or they'll get away!
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see Valeria, Devella, and a small cohort of Flaming fists running towards the player.

7.speaker: Narrator
7.text: It's all right for you, you've got bloody wings! Fists, ready weapons, prepare for - oh.
7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Devella retorts to the hollyphant, before barking orders at the flaming fists, ready for combat, before she spots the player.

35.speaker: Valeria
35.text: Oh indeed. It's you. Again. I must say - you've a real knack for sorting these things out.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: I'm just lucky I got here in time.

36.speaker: Valeria
36.text: I'd wager the whole damn city's lucky you got here. Now, I shall inspect the -

47.speaker: Player
47.text: And you've got a real knack for missing all the action.

21.speaker: Valeria
21.text: Say, I don't appreciate your tone. I am the Grand Investigator of the Fla-

39.speaker: Player
39.text: It's not sorted out, the killer wasn't working alone.

8.speaker: Valeria
8.text: Not working alone? What on earth do you -

41.speaker: Valeria
41.text: Oh dear gods. All that viscera... I'm feeling a bit q - queasy. Constable Fountainread, take point on this one. It'll be good experience.
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: the q - queasy here indicates valeria Valeria floats back at the end of this, retching

27.speaker: Narrator
27.text: That's so gracious of you, Investigator. Sorry about that, they came straight from Sharess' Caress.
27.context: CinematicNodeContext: The last sentence is said as an aside to the player, with devella miming drinking with her hand

15.speaker: Narrator
15.text: Solid work putting this one down. Can't have been easy. So, did you figure out why he was killing?

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Ascension. It was part of a ritual for Bhaal.

28.speaker: Narrator
28.text: You're quite right. It seems the Lord of Murder has been busy in Baldur's Gate.

29.speaker: Narrator
29.text: I did some digging, turns out Candulhallow's Tombstones boasts quite the sinister foot traffic these days.

2.speaker: Narrator
2.text: Including someone matching our killer's description. Which is odd, as it's been out of business as long as I've lived here.

10.speaker: Valeria
10.text: Y- yes, very good Devella. We suspect that's where the Bhaalist cult is situated. Whatever sick ritual they're up to must be stopped.

49.speaker: Valeria
49.text: So, it seems there's only one thing left to do. Once you destroy this Bhaalist cult, this whole business can be put to rest.

6.speaker: Narrator
6.text: I think the Investigator meant to say 'please'. We need your help to stop the cult.

30.speaker: Narrator
30.text: We tried to get into Candulhallow's. The cultists we saw spoke some sort of pass phrase, but we haven't found what it is yet.

26.speaker: Valeria
26.text: A few of them read it off a note they had - perhaps the killer you've just put down has one on his person.

24.speaker: Narrator
24.text: You managed to stop this maniac - we couldn't even find him. Stands to reason that you're our best bet at stopping the Bhaalists.

19.speaker: Valeria
19.text: This is fantastic news. I don't know what we'd have done if you said no.

0.speaker: Narrator
0.text: You'd have sent me, and I'd have died a particularly stupid hero.

31.speaker: Valeria
31.text: Well, thank Helm it didn't come to that. And, more pressingly, thank you.

12.speaker: Narrator
12.text: I agree. Baldur's Gate lends you its gratitude today. Good luck, friend.

40.speaker: Narrator
40.text: That's some bollocks. Without you, people will die.

17.speaker: Valeria
17.text: Devella. Compose yourself. Look, if you change your mind, go to Candulhallows. I implore you. If not... stay safe, citizen.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Any idea what to expect when I get there?

23.speaker: Valeria
23.text: That's rather excellent news. Although it might not be as simple as stopping one killer.

20.speaker: Valeria
20.text: Before you see this through, mortal - thank you. This city needs more folk like you.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I've seen enough murder, thanks. I'm not interested.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: [EVIL PATH] But if I did that, I couldn't become an avatar of slaughter. That sounds no fun at all.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: The cult are a charming lot, I want only the best for them.

42.speaker: Valeria
42.text: What do you... Oh. Oh. You're one of them. How did I not -

16.speaker: Narrator
16.text: FISTS! TO ME! DEFEND OUR CITY!

22.speaker: Player
22.text: He was insane, kept talking about bringing people's hands to his god.

51.speaker: Narrator
51.text: Unfortunately, he wasn't the only one - there's a Bhaalist cult at work here.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Everyone needs a hobby, I guess.

43.speaker: Narrator
43.text: This fellow had something a little bit more involved than a hobby.
